questions.label: G1A01
questions.text: On which HF/MF bands is a General class license holder granted all amateur frequency privileges?
distractors: 160 meters, 30 meters, 17 meters, 15 meters, 12 meters, and 10 meters
questions.answer: 160 meters, 60 meters, 30 meters, 17 meters, 12 meters, and 10 meters

questions.text: Which of the following frequencies is within the General class portion of the 75-meter phone band?

questions.label: G1A07
questions.text: Which of the following frequencies is within the General class portion of the 20-meter phone band?

questions.text: Which of the following frequencies is within the General class portion of the 80-meter band?

questions.label: G1A09
questions.text: Which of the following frequencies is within the General class portion of the 15-meter band?

questions.text: Which of the following frequencies is available to a control operator holding a General class license?

questions.label: G1A11
questions.text: When General class licensees are not permitted to use the entire voice portion of a band, which portion of the voice segment is generally available to them?
distractors: The lower frequency end on frequencies below 7.3 MHz, and the upper end on frequencies above 14.150 MHz
The upper frequency end on frequencies below 7.3 MHz, and the lower end on frequencies above 14.150 MHz

questions.label: G1A12
questions.text: Which of the following applies when the FCC rules designate the Amateur Service as a secondary user on a band?
distractors: Amateur stations must record the call sign of the primary service station before operating on a frequency assigned to that station
Amateur stations can use the band only during emergencies
Amateur stations may only operate during specific hours of the day, while primary users are permitted 24- hour use of the band
questions.answer: Amateur stations can use the band only if they do not cause harmful interference to primary users

questions.label: G1A13
questions.text: What is the appropriate action if, when operating on either the 30-meter or 60-meter bands, a station in the primary service interferes with your contact?
distractors: Notify the FCCs regional Engineer in Charge of the interference
Increase your transmitter's power to overcome the interference
Attempt to contact the station and request that it stop the interference
questions.answer: Move to a clear frequency or stop transmitting

questions.label: G1A14
questions.text: Which of the following may apply in areas under FCC jurisdiction outside of ITU Region 2?
distractors: Station identification may have to be in a language other than English
Morse code may not be permitted
Digital transmission may not be permitted

questions.label: G1A15
questions.text: What portion of the 10-meter band is available for repeater use?
distractors: The portion between 28.1 MHz and 28.2 MHz
The portion between 28.3 MHz and 28.5 MHz

subTopics.label: G1B
subTopics.description: Antenna structure limitations; good engineering and good amateur practice; beacon operation; prohibited

questions.label: G1B01
questions.text: What is the maximum height above ground to which an antenna structure may be erected without requiring notification to the FAA and registration with the FCC, provided it is not at or near a public use airport?

questions.label: G1B02
questions.text: With which of the following conditions must beacon stations comply?
distractors: A beacon station may not use automatic control
The frequency must be coordinated with the National Beacon Organization
The frequency must be posted on the internet or published in a national periodical
questions.answer: There must be no more than one beacon signal transmitting in the same band from the same station location

questions.label: G1B03
questions.text: Which of the following is a purpose of a beacon station as identified in the FCC rules?
distractors: Transmission of bulletins of general interest to Amateur Radio licensees

questions.label: G1B04
questions.text: Which of the following transmissions is permitted?
distractors: Unidentified transmissions for test purposes only
Retransmission of other amateur station signals by any amateur station
Coded messages of any kind, if not intended to facilitate a criminal act
questions.answer: Occasional retransmission of weather and propagation forecast information from U.S. government stations

questions.label: G1B05
questions.text: Which of the following one-way transmissions are permitted?
distractors: Unidentified test transmissions of less than one minute in duration
Regular transmissions offering equipment for sale, if intended for Amateur Radio use
questions.answer: Transmissions necessary to assist learning the International Morse code

questions.label: G1B06
questions.text: Under what conditions are state and local governments permitted to regulate Amateur Radio antenna structures?
distractors: Under no circumstances, FCC rules take priority
At any time and to any extent necessary to accomplish a legitimate purpose of the state or local entity, provided that proper filings are made with the FCC
Only when such structures exceed 50 feet in height and are clearly visible 1000 feet from the structure
questions.answer: Amateur Service communications must be reasonably accommodated, and regulations must constitute the minimum practical to accommodate a legitimate purpose of the state or local entity

questions.label: G1B07
questions.text: What are the restrictions on the use of abbreviations or procedural signals in the Amateur Service?
questions.answer: They may be used if they do not obscure the meaning of a message

questions.label: G1B08
questions.text: When choosing a transmitting frequency, what should you do to comply with good amateur practice?
distractors: Ensure that the frequency and mode selected are within your license class privileges
Follow generally accepted band plans agreed to by the Amateur Radio community

questions.label: G1B09
questions.text: On what HF frequencies are automatically controlled beacons permitted?
distractors: On any frequency if power is less than 1 watt
On any frequency if transmissions are in Morse code

questions.label: G1B10
questions.text: What is the power limit for beacon stations?

questions.label: G1B11
questions.text: Who or what determines "good engineering and good amateur practice," as applied to the operation of an amateur station in all respects not covered by the Part 97 rules?

questions.label: G1B12
questions.text: When is it permissible to communicate with amateur stations in countries outside the areas administered by the Federal Communications Commission?
distractors: Only when the foreign country has a formal third-party agreement filed with the FCC
When the contact is with amateurs in any country as long as the communication is conducted in English
Only when the foreign country is a member of the International Amateur Radio Union
questions.answer: When the contact is with amateurs in any country except those whose administrations have notified the ITU that they object to such communications

subTopics.label: G1C
subTopics.description: Transmitter power regulations; data emission standards; 60-meter operation requirements

questions.label: G1C01
questions.text: What is the maximum transmitting power an amateur station may use on 10.140 MHz?

questions.label: G1C02
questions.text: What is the maximum transmitting power an amateur station may use on the 12-meter band?
distractors: An effective radiated power equivalent to 100 watts from a half-wave dipole

questions.label: G1C03
questions.text: What is the maximum bandwidth permitted by FCC rules for Amateur Radio stations transmitting on USB frequencies in the 60-meter band?

questions.label: G1C04
questions.text: Which of the following limitations apply to transmitter power on every amateur band?
distractors: Power must be limited to 200 watts when using data transmissions
Power should be limited as necessary to avoid interference to another radio service on the frequency
Effective radiated power cannot exceed 1500 watts
questions.answer: Only the minimum power necessary to carry out the desired communications should be used

questions.label: G1C05
questions.text: What is the limit for transmitter power on the 28 MHz band for a General Class control operator?

questions.label: G1C06
questions.text: What is the limit for transmitter power on the 1.8 MHz band?

questions.label: G1C07
questions.text: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmission on the 20-meter band?

questions.label: G1C08
questions.text: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmitted at frequencies below 28 MHz?

questions.label: G1C09
questions.text: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmitted on the 1.25-meter and 70- centimeter bands?

questions.label: G1C10
questions.text: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmissions on the 10-meter band?

questions.label: G1C11
questions.text: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmissions on the 2-meter band?

questions.label: G1C12
questions.text: Which of the following is required by the FCC rules when operating in the 60-meter band?
distractors: You must keep a record of the date, time, frequency, power level, and stations worked
You must keep a record of all third-party traffic
You must keep a record of the manufacturer of your equipment and the antenna used
questions.answer: If you are using an antenna other than a dipole, you must keep a record of the gain of your antenna

questions.label: G1C13
questions.text: What must be done before using a new digital protocol on the air?
distractors: Obtain an experimental license from the FCC
Submit a rule-making proposal to the FCC describing the codes and methods of the technique
questions.answer: Publicly document the technical characteristics of the protocol

questions.label: G1C14
questions.text: What is the maximum power limit on the 60-meter band?
distractors: ERP of 100 watts PEP with respect to an isotropic antenna
questions.answer: ERP of 100 watts PEP with respect to a dipole

questions.label: G1C15
questions.text: What measurement is specified by FCC rules that regulate maximum power output?

subTopics.label: G1D
subTopics.description: Volunteer Examiners and Volunteer Examiner Coordinators; temporary identification; element credit

questions.label: G1D01
questions.text: Who may receive partial credit for the elements represented by an expired Amateur Radio license?
distractors: Anyone who held an FCC-issued Amateur Radio license that has been expired for not less than 5 years and not more than 15 years
Any person who previously held an amateur license issued by another country, but only if that country has a current reciprocal licensing agreement with the FCC
Only persons who once held an FCC issued Novice, Technician, or Technician Plus license
questions.answer: Any person who can demonstrate that they once held an FCC-issued General, Advanced, or Amateur Extra class license that was not revoked by the FCC

questions.label: G1D02
questions.text: What license examinations may you administer when you are an accredited VE holding a General class operator license?

questions.label: G1D03
questions.text: On which of the following band segments may you operate if you are a Technician class operator and have a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) for General class privileges?
distractors: Only the Technician band segments until your upgrade is posted in the FCC database
Only on the Technician band segments until your license arrives in the mail
On any General or Technician class band segment except 30 meters and 60 meters
questions.answer: On any General or Technician class band segment

questions.label: G1D04
questions.text: Which of the following is a requirement for administering a Technician class license examination?
distractors: At least two General class or higher VEs must be present
At least two General class or higher VEs must be present, but only one need be Amateur Extra class
At least three VEs of Technician class or higher must observe the examination
questions.answer: At least three General class or higher VEs must observe the examination

questions.label: G1D05
questions.text: Which of the following must a person have before they can be an administering VE for a Technician class license examination?
distractors: Notification to the FCC that you want to give an examination
Receipt of a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) for General class
Possession of a properly obtained telegraphy license
questions.answer: An FCC General class or higher license and VEC accreditation

questions.label: G1D06
questions.text: When must you add the special identifier "AG" after your call sign if you are a Technician class licensee and have a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) for General class operator privileges, but the FCC has not yet posted your upgrade on its website?
distractors: Whenever you operate on any amateur frequency
Whenever you operate using Technician frequency privileges
A special identifier is not required if your General class license application has been filed with the FCC
questions.answer: Whenever you operate using General class frequency privileges

questions.label: G1D07
questions.text: Volunteer Examiners are accredited by what organization?

questions.label: G1D08
questions.text: Which of the following criteria must be met for a non-U.S. citizen to be an accredited Volunteer Examiner?
distractors: The person must be a resident of the U.S. for a minimum of 5 years
The person's home citizenship must be in ITU region 2
None of these choices is correct; a non-U.S. citizen cannot be a Volunteer Examiner
questions.answer: The person must hold an FCC granted Amateur Radio license of General class or above

questions.label: G1D09
questions.text: How long is a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) valid for exam element credit?
distractors: For as long as your current license is valid

questions.label: G1D10
questions.text: What is the minimum age that one must be to qualify as an accredited Volunteer Examiner?

questions.label: G1D11
questions.text: What is required to obtain a new General Class license after a previously-held license has expired and the two- year grace period has passed?
distractors: They must have a letter from the FCC showing they once held an amateur or commercial license
There are no requirements other than being able to show a copy of the expired license
The applicant must be able to produce a copy of a page from a call book published in the U.S. showing his or her name and address
questions.answer: The applicant must pass the current Element 2 exam

subTopics.label: G1E
subTopics.description: Control categories; repeater regulations; third-party rules; ITU regions; automatically controlled digital

questions.label: G1E01
questions.text: Which of the following would disqualify a third party from participating in stating a message over an amateur station?
distractors: The third party is not a U.S. citizen
The third party is a licensed amateur
The third party is speaking in a language other than English
questions.answer: The third party's amateur license has been revoked and not reinstated

questions.label: G1E02
questions.text: When may a 10-meter repeater retransmit the 2-meter signal from a station that has a Technician class control operator?
distractors: Only if the station on 10-meters is operating under a Special Temporary Authorization allowing such retransmission
Only during an FCC-declared general state of communications emergency
questions.answer: Only if the 10-meter repeater control operator holds at least a General class license

questions.label: G1E03
questions.text: What is required to conduct communications with a digital station operating under automatic control outside the automatic control band segments?
distractors: The interrogating transmission must be made by another automatically controlled station
No third-party traffic may be transmitted
The control operator of the interrogating station must hold an Amateur Extra Class license
questions.answer: The station initiating the contact must be under local or remote control

questions.label: G1E04
questions.text: Which of the following conditions require a licensed Amateur Radio operator to take specific steps to avoid harmful interference to other users or facilities?
distractors: When operating within one mile of an FCC Monitoring Station
When using a band where the Amateur Service is secondary
When a station is transmitting spread spectrum emissions

questions.label: G1E05
questions.text: What types of messages for a third party in another country may be transmitted by an amateur station?
distractors: Any message, as long as the amateur operator is not paid
Only messages for other licensed amateurs
Any messages, as long as the text of the message is recorded in the station log
questions.answer: Only messages relating to Amateur Radio or remarks of a personal character, or messages relating to emergencies or disaster relief

questions.label: G1E06
questions.text: The frequency allocations of which ITU region apply to radio amateurs operating in North and South America?

questions.label: G1E07
questions.text: In what part of the 13-centimeter band may an amateur station communicate with non-licensed Wi-Fi stations?

questions.label: G1E08
questions.text: What is the maximum PEP output allowed for spread spectrum transmissions?

questions.label: G1E09
questions.text: Under what circumstances are messages that are sent via digital modes exempt from Part 97 third-party rules that apply to other modes of communication?

questions.label: G1E10
questions.text: Why should an amateur operator normally avoid transmitting on 14.100, 18.110, 21.150, 24. 930 and 28.200 MHz?
distractors: A system of automatic digital stations operates on those frequencies
These frequencies are set aside for emergency operations
These frequencies are set aside for bulletins from the FCC
questions.answer: A system of propagation beacon stations operates on those frequencies

questions.label: G1E11
questions.text: On what bands may automatically controlled stations transmitting RTTY or data emissions communicate with other automatically controlled digital station?
distractors: On any band segment where digital operation is permitted
Anywhere in the non-phone segments of the 10-meter or shorter wavelength bands
Only in the non-phone Extra Class segments of the bands
questions.answer: Anywhere in the 6-meter or shorter wavelength bands, and in limited segments of some of the HF bands

subTopics.label: G2A
subTopics.description: Phone operating procedures; USB/LSB conventions; breaking into a contact; VOX operation

questions.label: G2A01
questions.text: Which sideband is most commonly used for voice communications on frequencies of 14 MHz or higher?

questions.label: G2A02
questions.text: Which of the following modes is most commonly used for voice communications on the 160-meter, 75-meter, and 40-meter bands?

questions.label: G2A03
questions.text: Which of the following is most commonly used for SSB voice communications in the VHF and UHF bands?

questions.label: G2A04
questions.text: Which mode is most commonly used for voice communications on the 17-meter and 12-meter bands?

questions.label: G2A05
questions.text: Which mode of voice communication is most commonly used on the HF amateur bands?

questions.label: G2A06
questions.text: Which of the following is an advantage when using single sideband, as compared to other analog voice modes on the HF amateur bands?
distractors: Less subject to interference from atmospheric static crashes
Ease of tuning on receive and immunity to impulse noise
questions.answer: Less bandwidth used and greater power efficiency

questions.label: G2A07
questions.text: Which of the following statements is true of the single sideband voice mode?
distractors: Only one sideband and the carrier are transmitted; the other sideband is suppressed
SSB is the only voice mode that is authorized on the 20-meter, 15-meter, and 10-meter amateur bands
SSB is the only voice mode that is authorized on the 160-meter, 75-meter, and 40-meter amateur bands
questions.answer: Only one sideband is transmitted; the other sideband and carrier are suppressed

questions.label: G2A08
questions.text: What is the recommended way to break in to a phone contact?
distractors: Say "QRZ" several times, followed by your call sign
Say "CQ" followed by the call sign of either station

questions.label: G2A09
questions.text: Why do most amateur stations use lower sideband on the 160-meter, 75-meter, and 40-meter bands?
distractors: Lower sideband is more efficient than upper sideband at these frequencies
Lower sideband is the only sideband legal on these frequency bands
Because it is fully compatible with an AM detector

questions.label: G2A10
questions.text: Which of the following statements is true of voice VOX operation versus PTT operation?
distractors: The received signal is more natural sounding

questions.label: G2A11
questions.text: Generally, who should respond to a station in the contiguous 48 states who calls "CQ DX"?
distractors: Any caller is welcome to respond
questions.answer: Any stations outside the lower 48 states

subTopics.label: G2B
subTopics.description: Operating courtesy; band plans; emergencies, including drills and emergency communications

questions.label: G2B01
questions.text: Which of the following is true concerning access to frequencies?
distractors: QSOs in progress always have priority
Contest operations must always yield to non-contest use of frequencies
questions.answer: Except during emergencies, no amateur station has priority access to any frequency

questions.label: G2B02
questions.text: What is the first thing you should do if you are communicating with another amateur station and hear a station in distress break in?
distractors: Continue your communication because you were on the frequency first
questions.answer: Acknowledge the station in distress and determine what assistance may be needed

questions.label: G2B03
questions.text: What is good amateur practice if propagation changes during a contact and you notice interference from other stations on the frequency?
distractors: Tell the interfering stations to change frequency
Report the interference to your local Amateur Auxiliary Coordinator
questions.answer: Attempt to resolve the interference problem with the other stations in a mutually acceptable manner

questions.label: G2B04
questions.text: When selecting a CW transmitting frequency, what minimum separation should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?

questions.label: G2B05
questions.text: When selecting an SSB transmitting frequency, what minimum separation should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?

questions.label: G2B06
questions.text: What is a practical way to avoid harmful interference on an apparently clear frequency before calling CQ on CW or phone?
distractors: Listen for 2 minutes before calling CQ
Send the letter "V" in Morse code several times and listen for a response, or say "test" several times and listen for a response
Send "QSY" on CW or if using phone, announce "the frequency is in use," then give your call sign and listen for a response
questions.answer: Send "QRL?" on CW, followed by your call sign; or, if using phone, ask if the frequency is in use, followed by your call sign

questions.label: G2B07
questions.text: Which of the following complies with good amateur practice when choosing a frequency on which to initiate a call?
distractors: Check to see if the channel is assigned to another station
Identify your station by transmitting your call sign at least 3 times
questions.answer: Follow the voluntary band plan for the operating mode you intend to use

questions.label: G2B08
questions.text: What is the voluntary band plan restriction for U.S. stations transmitting within the 48 contiguous states in the 50.1 to 50.125 MHz band segment?
distractors: Only contacts with other stations within the 48 contiguous states
questions.answer: Only contacts with stations not within the 48 contiguous states

questions.label: G2B09
questions.text: Who may be the control operator of an amateur station transmitting in RACES to assist relief operations during a disaster?
distractors: Only a RACES net control operator
A person holding an FCC-issued amateur operator license or an appropriate government official
Any control operator when normal communication systems are operational
questions.answer: Only a person holding an FCC-issued amateur operator license

questions.label: G2B10
questions.text: When is an amateur station allowed to use any means at its disposal to assist another station in distress?
distractors: At any time when transmitting in an organized net
questions.answer: At any time during an actual emergency

questions.label: G2B11
questions.text: What frequency should be used to send a distress call?
distractors: Only frequencies authorized for RACES or ARES stations
Only frequencies that are within your operating privileges
Only frequencies used by police, fire, or emergency medical services
questions.answer: Whichever frequency has the best chance of communicating the distress message

subTopics.label: G2C
subTopics.description: CW operating procedures and procedural signals; Q signals and common abbreviations: full break-in

questions.label: G2C01
questions.text: Which of the following describes full break-in telegraphy (QSK)?
distractors: Breaking stations send the Morse code prosign "BK"
Automatic keyers, instead of hand keys, are used to send Morse code
An operator must activate a manual send/receive switch before and after every transmission
questions.answer: Transmitting stations can receive between code characters and elements

questions.label: G2C02
questions.text: What should you do if a CW station sends "QRS?"

questions.label: G2C03
questions.text: What does it mean when a CW operator sends "KN" at the end of a transmission?
questions.answer: Listening only for a specific station or stations

questions.label: G2C04
questions.text: What does the Q signal "QRL?" mean?
distractors: "Are you operating full break-in?" or "Can you operate full break-in?"
"Are you listening only for a specific station?"
questions.answer: "Are you busy?" or "Is this frequency in use?"

questions.label: G2C05
questions.text: What is the best speed to use when answering a CQ in Morse code?
distractors: The fastest speed at which you are comfortable copying, but no slower than the CQ
At the standard calling speed of 10 wpm
At the standard calling speed of 5 wpm
questions.answer: The fastest speed at which you are comfortable copying, but no faster than the CQ

questions.label: G2C06
questions.text: What does the term "zero beat" mean in CW operation?
distractors: Matching the speed of the transmitting station
Operating split to avoid interference on frequency
questions.answer: Matching the transmit frequency to the frequency of a received signal

questions.label: G2C07
questions.text: When sending CW, what does a "C" mean when added to the RST report?
distractors: Report was read from an S meter rather than estimated

questions.label: G2C08
questions.text: What prosign is sent to indicate the end of a formal message when using CW?

questions.label: G2C09
questions.text: What does the Q signal "QSL" mean?
distractors: We have already confirmed by card

questions.label: G2C10
questions.text: What does the Q signal "QRN" mean?

questions.label: G2C11
questions.text: What does the Q signal "QRV" mean?
distractors: There is interference on the frequency
I am quitting for the day
questions.answer: I am ready to receive messages

subTopics.label: G2D
subTopics.description: Volunteer Monitoring Program; HF operations

questions.label: G2D01
questions.text: What is the Volunteer Monitoring Program?
distractors: Amateur volunteers who conduct amateur licensing examinations
Amateur volunteers who conduct frequency coordination for amateur VHF repeaters
Amateur volunteers who use their station equipment to help civil defense organizations in times of emergency
questions.answer: Amateur volunteers who are formally enlisted to monitor the airwaves for rules violations

questions.label: G2D02
questions.text: Which of the following are objectives of the Volunteer Monitoring Program?
distractors: To conduct efficient and orderly amateur licensing examinations
To coordinate repeaters for efficient and orderly spectrum usage
To provide emergency and public safety communications
questions.answer: To encourage amateur radio operators to self-regulate and comply with the rules

questions.label: G2D03
questions.text: What skills learned during hidden transmitter hunts are of help to the Volunteer Monitoring Program?
distractors: Hunters have an opportunity to transmit on non-amateur frequencies
questions.answer: Direction finding used to locate stations violating FCC rules

questions.label: G2D04
questions.text: Which of the following describes an azimuthal projection map?
distractors: A map that shows accurate land masses
A map that shows the angle at which an amateur satellite crosses the equator
A map that shows the number of degrees longitude that an amateur satellite appears to move westward at the equator with each orbit
questions.answer: A map that shows true bearings and distances from a particular location

questions.label: G2D05
questions.text: Which of the following is a good way to indicate on a clear frequency in the HF phone bands that you are looking for a contact with any station?
distractors: Sign your call sign once, followed by the words "listening for a call" -- if no answer, change frequency and repeat
Say "QTC" followed by "this is" and your call sign -- if no answer, change frequency and repeat
Transmit an unmodulated carried for approximately 10 seconds, followed by "this is" and your call sign, and pause to listen -- repeat as necessary
questions.answer: Repeat "CQ" a few times, followed by "this is," then your call sign a few times, then pause to listen, repeat as necessary

questions.label: G2D06
questions.text: How is a directional antenna pointed when making a "long-path" contact with another station?
questions.answer: 180 degrees from the station's short-path heading

questions.label: G2D07
questions.text: Which of the following are examples of the NATO Phonetic Alphabet?

questions.label: G2D08
questions.text: What is a reason why many amateurs keep a station log?
distractors: The ITU requires a log of all international contacts
The ITU requires a log of all international third-party traffic
The log provides evidence of operation needed to renew a license without retest
questions.answer: To help with a reply if the FCC requests information

questions.label: G2D09
questions.text: Which of the following is required when participating in a contest on HF frequencies?
distractors: Submit a log to the contest sponsor
Send a QSL card to the stations worked, or QSL via Logbook of The World
questions.answer: Identify your station per normal FCC regulations

questions.label: G2D10
questions.text: What is QRP operation?

questions.label: G2D11
questions.text: Which of the following is typical of the lower HF frequencies during the summer?
distractors: Poor propagation at any time of day
World-wide propagation during the daylight hours
Heavy distortion on signals due to photon absorption
questions.answer: High levels of atmospheric noise or "static"

subTopics.description: Digital operating procedures

questions.label: G2E01
questions.text: Which mode is normally used when sending RTTY signals via AFSK with an SSB transmitter?

questions.label: G2E02
questions.text: How can a PACTOR modem or controller be used to determine if the channel is in use by other PACTOR stations?
distractors: Unplug the data connector temporarily and see if the channel-busy indication is turned off
Transmit UI packets several times and wait to see if there is a response from another PACTOR station
Send the message, "Is this frequency in use?"
questions.answer: Put the modem or controller in a mode which allows monitoring communications without a connection

questions.label: G2E03
questions.text: What symptoms may result from other signals interfering with a PACTOR or WINMOR transmission?
distractors: Failure to establish a connection between stations

questions.text: What segment of the 20-meter band is most often used for digital transmissions (avoiding the DX propagation beacons)?

questions.text: What is the standard sideband used to generate a JT65, JT9, or FT8 digital signal when using AFSK in any amateur band?

questions.text: What is one disadvantage of a directly fed random-wire HF antenna?
distractors: It must be longer than 1 wavelength
It produces only vertically polarized radiation
It is more effective on the lower HF bands than on the higher bands
questions.answer: You may experience RF burns when touching metal objects in your station

questions.label: G9B02
questions.text: Which of the following is a common way to adjust the feed-point impedance of a quarter wave ground-plane vertical antenna to be approximately 50 ohms?

questions.label: G9B03
questions.text: Which of the following best describes the radiation pattern of a quarter-wave, ground-plane vertical antenna?

questions.label: G9B04
questions.text: What is the radiation pattern of a dipole antenna in free space in a plane containing the conductor?
distractors: It is a figure-eight off both ends of the antenna
It is a circle (equal radiation in all directions)
It has a pair of lobes on one side of the antenna and a single lobe on the other side
questions.answer: It is a figure-eight at right angles to the antenna

questions.label: G9B05
questions.text: How does antenna height affect the horizontal (azimuthal) radiation pattern of a horizontal dipole HF antenna?
distractors: If the antenna is too high, the pattern becomes unpredictable
Antenna height has no effect on the pattern
If the antenna is less than 1/2 wavelength high, radiation off the ends of the wire is eliminated
questions.answer: If the antenna is less than 1/2 wavelength high, the azimuthal pattern is almost omnidirectional

questions.label: G9B06
questions.text: Where should the radial wires of a ground-mounted vertical antenna system be placed?
distractors: As high as possible above the ground
At the center of the antenna
questions.answer: On the surface of the Earth or buried a few inches below the ground

questions.label: G9B07
questions.text: How does the feed-point impedance of a 1/2 wave dipole antenna change as the antenna is lowered below 1/4 wave above ground?
distractors: It peaks at about 1/8 wavelength above ground
It is unaffected by the height above ground

questions.label: G9B08
questions.text: How does the feed point impedance of a 1/2 wave dipole change as the feed point is moved from the center toward the ends?
distractors: It peaks at about 1/8 wavelength from the end
It is unaffected by the location of the feed point

questions.label: G9B09

subTopics.label: G9C
subTopics.description: Directional antennas

questions.label: G9C01
questions.text: Which of the following would increase the bandwidth of a Yagi antenna?
distractors: Loading coils in series with the element

questions.label: G9C02
questions.text: What is the approximate length of the driven element of a Yagi antenna?

questions.label: G9C03
questions.text: How do the lengths of a three-element Yagi reflector and director compare to that of the driven element?
distractors: The reflector is shorter, and the director is longer
They are all the same length
Relative length depends on the frequency of operation
questions.answer: The reflector is longer, and the director is shorter

questions.label: G9C04
questions.text: How does antenna gain stated in dBi compare to gain stated in dBd for the same antenna?
distractors: dBi gain figures are 2.15 dB lower than dBd gain figures
dBi gain figures are the same as the square root of dBd gain figures multiplied by 2.15
dBi gain figures are the reciprocal of dBd gain figures + 2.15 dB
questions.answer: dBi gain figures are 2.15 dB higher than dBd gain figures

questions.label: G9C05
questions.text: How does increasing boom length and adding directors affect a Yagi antenna?

questions.label: G9C06
questions.text: What configuration of the loops of a two-element quad antenna must be used for the antenna to operate as a beam antenna, assuming one of the elements is used as a reflector?
distractors: The driven element must be fed with a balun transformer
There must be an open circuit in the driven element at the point opposite the feed point
The reflector element must be approximately 5 percent shorter than the driven element
questions.answer: The reflector element must be approximately 5 percent longer than the driven element

questions.label: G9C07
questions.text: What does "front-to-back ratio" mean in reference to a Yagi antenna?
distractors: The number of directors versus the number of reflectors
The relative position of the driven element with respect to the reflectors and directors
The ratio of forward gain to dipole gain
questions.answer: The power radiated in the major radiation lobe compared to that in the opposite direction

questions.label: G9C08
questions.text: What is meant by the "main lobe" of a directive antenna?
distractors: The magnitude of the maximum vertical angle of radiation
The point of maximum current in a radiating antenna element
The maximum voltage standing wave point on a radiating element
questions.answer: The direction of maximum radiated field strength from the antenna

questions.label: G9C09
questions.text: How does the gain of two three-element, horizontally polarized Yagi antennas spaced vertically 1/2 wavelength apart typically compare to the gain of a single three-element Yagi?

questions.label: G9C10
questions.text: Which of the following can be adjusted to optimize forward gain, front-to-back ratio, or SWR bandwidth of a Yagi antenna?
distractors: The physical length of the boom
The number of elements on the boom
The spacing of each element along the boom

questions.label: G9C11
questions.text: Which HF antenna would be the best to use for minimizing interference?

questions.label: G9C12
questions.text: Which of the following is an advantage of using a gamma match with a Yagi antenna?
distractors: It does not require any inductors or capacitors
It is useful for matching multiband antennas
questions.answer: It does not require that the driven element be insulated from the boom

questions.label: G9C13
questions.text: Approximately how long is each side of the driven element of a quad antenna?

questions.label: G9C14
questions.text: How does the forward gain of a two-element quad antenna compare to the forward gain of a three-element Yagi antenna?

questions.label: G9C15
questions.text: What is meant by the terms dBi and dBd when referring to antenna gain?
distractors: dBi refers to an ionospheric reflecting antenna, dBd refers to a dissipative antenna
dBi refers to an inverted-vee antenna, dBd refers to a downward reflecting antenna
dBi refers to an isometric antenna, dBd refers to a discone antenna
questions.answer: dBi refers to an isotropic antenna, dBd refers to a dipole antenna

questions.label: G9C16
questions.text: What is a beta or hairpin match?
distractors: It is a  wavelength section of 75 ohm coax in series with the feed point of a Yagi to provide impedance matching
It is a series capacitor selected to cancel the inductive reactance of a folded dipole antenna
It is a section of 300 ohm twinlead used to match a folded dipole antenna
questions.answer: It is a shorted transmission line stub placed at the feed point of a Yagi antenna to provide impedance matching

subTopics.label: G9D
subTopics.description: Specialized antennas

questions.label: G9D01
questions.text: Which of the following antenna types will be most effective as a Near Vertical Incidence Skywave (NVIS) antenna for short-skip communications on 40 meters during the day?
distractors: A vertical antenna placed between 1/4 and 1/2 wavelength above the ground
questions.answer: A horizontal dipole placed between 1/10 and 1/4 wavelength above the ground

questions.label: G9D02
questions.text: What is the feed-point impedance of an end-fed half-wave antenna?

questions.label: G9D03
questions.text: In which direction is the maximum radiation from a portable VHF/UHF "halo" antenna?
distractors: Broadside to the plane of the halo
questions.answer: Omnidirectional in the plane of the halo

questions.label: G9D04
questions.text: What is the primary purpose of antenna traps?

questions.label: G9D05
questions.text: What is an advantage of vertical stacking of horizontally polarized Yagi antennas?
distractors: It allows quick selection of vertical or horizontal polarization
It allows simultaneous vertical and horizontal polarization
It narrows the main lobe in azimuth
questions.answer: It narrows the main lobe in elevation

questions.label: G9D06
questions.text: Which of the following is an advantage of a log periodic antenna?
distractors: Higher gain per element than a Yagi antenna

questions.label: G9D07
questions.text: Which of the following describes a log periodic antenna?
distractors: Impedance varies periodically as a function of frequency
Gain varies logarithmically as a function of frequency
SWR varies periodically as a function of boom length
questions.answer: Element length and spacing vary logarithmically along the boom

questions.label: G9D08
questions.text: How does a "screwdriver" mobile antenna adjust its feed-point impedance?
distractors: By extending and retracting the whip
questions.answer: By varying the base loading inductance

questions.label: G9D09
questions.text: What is the primary use of a Beverage antenna?
distractors: Directional transmitting for low HF bands
Portable direction finding at higher HF frequencies
Portable direction finding at lower HF frequencies
questions.answer: Directional receiving for low HF bands

questions.label: G9D10
questions.text: In which direction or directions does an electrically small loop (less than 1/3 wavelength in circumference) have nulls in its radiation pattern?
distractors: In the plane of the loop
Broadside and in the plane of the loop

questions.label: G9D11
questions.text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of multiband antennas?
distractors: They present low impedance on all design frequencies
They must be used with an antenna tuner
They must be fed with open wire line

questions.label: G9D12
questions.text: What is the common name of a dipole with a single central support?

questions.label: G9D13
questions.text: What is the combined vertical and horizontal polarization pattern of a multi-wavelength, horizontal loop antenna?
distractors: A figure-eight, similar to a dipole
Four major loops with deep nulls
questions.answer: Virtually omnidirectional with a lower peak vertical radiation angle than a dipole

subTopics.label: G0A
subTopics.description: RF safety principles, rules and guidelines; routine station evaluation

questions.label: G0A01
questions.text: What is one way that RF energy can affect human body tissue?
distractors: It causes the blood count to reach a dangerously low level

questions.label: G0A02
questions.text: Which of the following properties is important in estimating whether an RF signal exceeds the maximum permissible exposure (MPE)?

questions.label: G0A03
questions.text: How can you determine that your station complies with FCC RF exposure regulations?
distractors: By calculation based on FCC OET Bulletin 65
By calculation based on computer modeling
By measurement of field strength using calibrated equipment

questions.label: G0A04
questions.text: What does "time averaging" mean in reference to RF radiation exposure?
distractors: The average amount of power developed by the transmitter over a specific 24-hour period
The average time it takes RF radiation to have any long-term effect on the body
The total time of the exposure
questions.answer: The total RF exposure averaged over a certain time

questions.label: G0A05
questions.text: What must you do if an evaluation of your station shows RF energy radiated from your station exceeds permissible limits?
distractors: File an Environmental Impact Statement (EIS-97) with the FCC
Secure written permission from your neighbors to operate above the controlled MPE limits
questions.answer: Take action to prevent human exposure to the excessive RF fields

questions.label: G0A06
questions.text: What precaution should be taken when installing a ground-mounted antenna?
distractors: It should not be installed higher than you can reach
It should not be installed in a wet area
It should be limited to 10 feet in height
questions.answer: It should be installed such that it is protected against unauthorized access

questions.label: G0A07
questions.text: What effect does transmitter duty cycle have when evaluating RF exposure?
distractors: A higher transmitter duty cycle permits greater short-term exposure levels
Low duty cycle transmitters are exempt from RF exposure evaluation requirements
High duty cycle transmitters are exempt from RF exposure requirements
questions.answer: A lower transmitter duty cycle permits greater short-term exposure levels

questions.label: G0A08
questions.text: Which of the following steps must an amateur operator take to ensure compliance with RF safety regulations when transmitter power exceeds levels specified in FCC Part 97.13?
distractors: Post a copy of FCC Part 97.13 in the station
Post a copy of OET Bulletin 65 in the station
Contact the FCC for a visit to conduct a station evaluation
questions.answer: Perform a routine RF exposure evaluation

questions.label: G0A09
questions.text: What type of instrument can be used to accurately measure an RF field?
distractors: A receiver with an S meter
An SWR meter with a peak-reading function
An oscilloscope with a high-stability crystal marker generator
questions.answer: A calibrated field strength meter with a calibrated antenna

questions.label: G0A10
questions.text: What is one thing that can be done if evaluation shows that a neighbor might receive more than the allowable limit of RF exposure from the main lobe of a directional antenna?
distractors: Change to a non-polarized antenna with higher gain
Post a warning sign that is clearly visible to the neighbor
Use an antenna with a higher front-to-back ratio
questions.answer: Take precautions to ensure that the antenna cannot be pointed in their direction

questions.label: G0A11
questions.text: What precaution should you take if you install an indoor transmitting antenna?
distractors: Locate the antenna close to your operating position to minimize feed-line radiation
Position the antenna along the edge of a wall to reduce parasitic radiation
Make sure the antenna is properly shielded
questions.answer: Make sure that MPE limits are not exceeded in occupied areas

subTopics.label: G0B
subTopics.description: Station safety: electrical shock, safety grounding, fusing, interlocks, wiring, antenna and tower safety

questions.label: G0B01
questions.text: Which wire or wires in a four-conductor connection should be attached to fuses or circuit breakers in a device operated from a 240 VAC single phase source?
questions.answer: Only the two wires carrying voltage

questions.label: G0B02
questions.text: According to the National Electrical Code, what is the minimum wire size that may be used safely for wiring with a 20 ampere circuit breaker?

questions.label: G0B03
questions.text: Which size of fuse or circuit breaker would be appropriate to use with a circuit that uses AWG number 14 wiring?

questions.label: G0B04
questions.text: Which of the following is a primary reason for not placing a gasoline-fueled generator inside an occupied area?
distractors: Lack of oxygen for adequate combustion
Lack of nitrogen for adequate combustion

questions.label: G0B05
questions.text: Which of the following conditions will cause a Ground Fault Circuit Interrupter (GFCI) to disconnect the 120 or 240 Volt AC line power to a device?
distractors: Current flowing from one or more of the voltage-carrying wires to the neutral wire
questions.answer: Current flowing from one or more of the voltage-carrying wires directly to ground

questions.label: G0B06
questions.text: Which of the following is covered by the National Electrical Code?
distractors: RF exposure limits of the human body
questions.answer: Electrical safety inside the ham shack

questions.label: G0B07
questions.text: Which of these choices should be observed when climbing a tower using a safety belt or harness?
distractors: Never lean back and rely on the belt alone to support your weight
Ensure that all heavy tools are securely fastened to the belt D-ring
questions.answer: Confirm that the belt is rated for the weight of the climber and that it is within its allowable service life

questions.label: G0B08
questions.text: What should be done by any person preparing to climb a tower that supports electrically powered devices?
distractors: Notify the electric company that a person will be working on the tower
Unground the base of the tower
questions.answer: Make sure all circuits that supply power to the tower are locked out and tagged

questions.label: G0B09
questions.text: Which of the following is true of an emergency generator installation?
distractors: The generator must be insulated from ground
Fuel should be stored near the generator for rapid refueling in case of an emergency
questions.answer: The generator should be located in a well-ventilated area

questions.label: G0B10
questions.text: Which of the following is a danger from lead-tin solder?
distractors: High voltages can cause lead-tin solder to disintegrate suddenly
Tin in the solder can "cold flow," causing shorts in the circuit
RF energy can convert the lead into a poisonous gas
questions.answer: Lead can contaminate food if hands are not washed carefully after handling the solder

questions.label: G0B11
questions.text: Which of the following is good practice for lightning protection grounds?
distractors: They must be bonded to all buried water and gas lines
Bends in ground wires must be made as close as possible to a right angle
Lightning grounds must be connected to all ungrounded wiring
questions.answer: They must be bonded together with all other grounds

questions.label: G0B12
questions.text: What is the purpose of a power supply interlock?
distractors: To prevent unauthorized changes to the circuit that would void the manufacturer's warranty
To shut down the unit if it becomes too hot
To shut off the power supply if too much voltage is produced
questions.answer: To ensure that dangerous voltages are removed if the cabinet is opened

questions.label: G0B13
questions.text: What must you do when powering your house from an emergency generator?
distractors: Insure that the generator is not grounded
Insure that all lightning grounds are disconnected
questions.answer: Disconnect the incoming utility power feed

questions.label: G0B14
questions.text: What precaution should you take whenever you adjust or repair an antenna?
distractors: Ensure that you and the antenna structure are grounded
questions.answer: Turn off the transmitter and disconnect the feed line
